Adult.description: Clark's Grebes have brighter yellow bills than Western Grebes, and the bill has a dark line along the top. The black cap of Clark's does not extend down to surround the eye, as it does on Western.

Nonbreeding.description: Red-necked Grebes are smaller and less slender than Western Grebes. They have a stouter bill and are more gray-washed (less clean-cut black and white) than Western Grebes.

Nonbreeding/immature.description: Common Loons are larger and stockier than Western Grebes, with a shorter neck, a larger head, and a much heftier, daggerlike, all-dark bill.
